author: Simple History
description:
This video was made possible thanks to everyone on the Simple History Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/simplehistory

Marketed in Paris as a “New Eden,” French Louisiana was anything but paradise — swamps, disease, and a struggling settlement of only hundreds. John Law’s Mississippi stock bubble turned the colony into Europe’s hottest investment, leading France to forcibly deport and mass-marry settlers when no one volunteered. New Orleans survived not by promises, but by the resilience of the forgotten.

Check out our other Channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCPdc6bs3I8s6Y4QE_3g3MZw

title: The Women Who Were Forced to Marry Prisoners in Louisiana
